title: rake db:migrate broken
body_html:
hey

i just tried to setup the teams app and the migrations are not running through.

undefined method `project_proposals_open_at' for #<Season:0x007fe1784709f8>/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/app/models/season.rb:96:in `set_application_dates'
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/app/models/season.rb:9:in `current'
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/db/migrate/20150625085615_add_seasons_to_mailings.rb:4:in `change'
NoMethodError: undefined method `project_proposals_open_at' for #<Season:0x007fe1784709f8>
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/app/models/season.rb:96:in `set_application_dates'
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/app/models/season.rb:9:in `current'
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/db/migrate/20150625085615_add_seasons_to_mailings.rb:4:in `change'
Tasks: TOP => db:migrate
(See full trace by running task with --trace)

the problem is that in 20150625085615_add_seasons_to_mailings.rb we try to access Season.current which tried to create a Season with attributes project_proposals_open_at that are not present yet in the current point of migrations.

what do you think would be a good fix? i can work on it!
what i usually do is to squash the migrations. there is no point in having 120 migration files. i would usually squash all migrations that are older than 1-2 months in 1 big migrations. this allows you to still revert deployments and do down migrations. i doubt that there is value in really old migration files.

let me know what you think about this. happy to work on any solution.

best
ben

body:
hey

i just tried to setup the teams app and the migrations are not running through.

```
undefined method `project_proposals_open_at' for #<Season:0x007fe1784709f8>/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/app/models/season.rb:96:in `set_application_dates'
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/app/models/season.rb:9:in `current'
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/db/migrate/20150625085615_add_seasons_to_mailings.rb:4:in `change'
NoMethodError: undefined method `project_proposals_open_at' for #<Season:0x007fe1784709f8>
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/app/models/season.rb:96:in `set_application_dates'
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/app/models/season.rb:9:in `current'
/Users/ben/Development/rgsoc-teams/db/migrate/20150625085615_add_seasons_to_mailings.rb:4:in `change'
Tasks: TOP => db:migrate
(See full trace by running task with --trace)
```

the problem is that in `20150625085615_add_seasons_to_mailings.rb` we try to access `Season.current` which tried to create a Season with attributes `project_proposals_open_at` that are not present yet in the current point of migrations.

what do you think would be a good fix? i can work on it!
what i usually do is to squash the migrations. there is no point in having 120 migration files. i would usually squash all migrations that are older than 1-2 months in 1 big migrations. this allows you to still revert deployments and do down migrations. i doubt that there is value in really old migration files.

let me know what you think about this. happy to work on any solution.

best
ben
